channel.title: Talks By Neal A. Maxwell
channel.description: General Conference talks by Neal A. Maxwell.

item.title: Response to a Call
item.description: Brothers and sisters, my verbal moment is not for sermons but for appreciation, not for doctrine but for testimony.

item.title: Why Not Now?

item.title: “Jesus of Nazareth, Savior and King”
item.description: My fellowmen, it matters so very much how we regard and view Jesus Christ. Some seek to substitute Caesars for Christ. Others are blinded because they are “looking beyond the mark” () when the mark is Christ. Many sects—without the reinforcing rods o

item.title: Notwithstanding My Weakness
item.description: First, my brothers and sisters, my gratitude to the prophet and his counselors for this call. To them, to Elder Richards and the members of the First Quorum of the Seventy I pledge that my little footnote on the page of the quorum’s history will read

item.title: The Net Gathers of Every Kind
item.description: Brothers and sisters, we must be more ready than we now are to receive the hundreds of thousands of individuals “of every kind” who are gathered into the gospel net from nearly every culture and circumstance (see ).

item.title: “O, Divine Redeemer”
item.description: My brothers and sisters: I publicly express my deep gratitude to the Lord, to our remarkable and beloved President Kimball, and to his counselors for my call to the Twelve—among whom I shall be the least, long after being the last so ordained.

item.title: “A Brother Offended”
item.description: Our Shepherd, Jesus Christ, has repeatedly given us counsel, brethren, about those things which can cause some in His flock to become inactive, indifferent, offended, or to fall away. The cares and pleasures of the world, temptation, persecution, tri

item.title: “Be of Good Cheer”
item.description: My brothers and sisters, we are living in a time in which we shall see things both wonderful and awful. There is no way that we can be a part of the last days and have it otherwise. Even so, we are instructed by our Lord and Exemplar, Jesus Christ, t

item.title: “Shine As Lights in the World”
item.description: For many years now—in literature, film, and music—we have witnessed increasing expressions of a profound sense of what has come to be called existential despair, a hopelessness beyond hope. Granted, the human scene also includes many individuals who

item.title: Joseph, the Seer
item.description: Throughout the expanse of human history, no prophet has been scrutinized in such a sustained way, on as wide a scale, or for so long a period of time as Joseph Smith, Jr. The communication capacity of this age and the global impact of his work have s

item.title: The Great Plan of the Eternal God
item.description: My public and warm welcome to Elder Nelson and Elder Oaks, choice friends of many years, as they now enter into an even deeper friendship.

item.title: “Out of Obscurity”
item.description: My brothers and sisters, the Church is at one of those hinge points in its history—the ending of one era and the beginning of another, each with its blessings and its challenges. If we are prepared, we shall neither fear nor fail in our particular ti

item.title: “Willing to Submit”
item.description: I do not apologize for trying to speak about one of what Paul called “the deep things of God,” (), only for my inability to go deeply enough.

item.title: Premortality, a Glorious Reality
item.description: In case you hadn’t noticed it, in the last days, discipleship is to be lived Our adversities and extremities will merely bring out the strong simplicities and the reassuring realities of the gospel. Likewise, brisk challenges to basic beliefs, and s

item.title: “Called and Prepared from the Foundation of the World”
item.description: What if in tomorrow’s newspapers and on television scholars excitedly announced that dozens of pages of startling and significant writings, including those of Enoch, Abraham, and Moses, had been found? These startling writings inform us, among many i

item.title: “God Will Yet Reveal”
item.description: The holy scriptures represent mankind’s spiritual memory. And when man’s connection with scripture is severed, mortals are tragically deprived of an awareness of spiritual history, blinding the eyes of faith. Thereby shorn of true identity, mortals k

item.title: “Overcome … Even As I Also Overcame”
item.description: Events and circumstances in the last days make it imperative for us as members of the Church to become more grounded, rooted, established, and settled (see ; ; ). Jesus said to His disciples, “settle this in your hearts, that ye will do the things wh

item.title: “Yet Thou Art There”
item.description: What John and Paul wrote about God’s creations and the plurality of worlds, the restored gospel grandly affirms, declaring that “worlds without number” have been created (; see also ; ; ; ). These gospel truths are very significant assurances for us,

item.title: “For I Will Lead You Along”
item.description: Thank you, President Benson, for that sermon on the first commandment, and even more, for the way in which you implement it by your expressions of your love for all of us.

item.title: “Answer Me”
item.description: I join in welcoming all the new Brethren, including Elder Richard Scott to the Council of the Twelve.

item.title: Irony: The Crust on the Bread of Adversity
item.description: What I now read is a most wintry verse indeed: “Nevertheless the Lord seeth fit to chasten his people; yea, he trieth their patience and their faith.” (.)

item.title: “Murmur Not”
item.description: With all of you, I express my admiration to these wonderful men who are being released and whose status is being adjusted. They were exemplary at the time of their calls; they are even more so today. They are portable sermons for us all. My sermon wa

item.title: “Endure It Well”
item.description: May I add my personal welcome to those brethren and sisters newly sustained today. What has happened today would not have occurred had you not married so well spiritually so many years ago.

item.title: Put Off the Natural Man, and Come Off Conqueror
item.description: So many times prophets warn about the dangers of selfishness—the inordinate and excessive concern with self. The distance between constant self-pleasing and self-worship is shorter than we think. Stubborn selfishness is actually rebellion against God

item.title: “Lest Ye Be Wearied and Faint in Your Minds”
item.description: Having all been richly nourished by this general conference, it is fitting to focus prescriptively on the few in the Church who remain spiritually undernourished, including those who have grown weary and fainted in their minds. (See .)

item.title: Repentance
item.description: With you, I rejoice in the testimony and talent of these new Brethren.

item.title: “My Servant Joseph”
item.description: My focus, in a few headlines, will be on the remarkable man whom the Lord repeatedly and affectionately called “my servant Joseph.” (.) What followed Joseph Smith’s prayer in the spring of 1820 irrevocably illuminated our view of God, ourselves, othe

item.title: “Settle This in Your Hearts”
item.description: This is an appropriate moment to thank Elder Hanks for his influence on my life in so many moments over so many years.

item.title: “Behold, the Enemy Is Combined” (D&C 38:12)
item.description: Years ago, I wondered over the scriptural imagery of angels waiting “day and night” for “the great command” to come down and reap the tares in a wicked and suffering world; it seemed rather eager to me. (See ; .) Given such massive, needless human su

item.title: “From the Beginning”
item.description: Teaching about history’s major apostasies has long been one of the restored gospel’s “givens,” but it is not always given much attention. My aim, therefore, is internal instruction, not external persuasion, since we fully understand that certain of o

item.title: “Take Especial Care of Your Family”
item.description: During the last days, when “all things shall be in commotion” (), the restored gospel of Jesus Christ provides so many essential things, including precious perspective of seeing “things as they really are” ().

item.title: “Brightness of Hope”
item.description: As I raised my arm this morning, I raise my voice this afternoon gladly to sustain President Hunter. He is a meek and special man. And, as we’ve heard the testimonies from two new Apostles whom we sustained this morning, I raise my sustaining voice t

item.title: “Deny Yourselves of All Ungodliness”
item.description: I join in welcoming Elder Henry B. Eyring to the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles, who are so ably presided over by President Boyd K. Packer. Elder Eyring is a special blend of brightness and sweetness. I am delighted to sustain President James E. Faust

item.title: “Swallowed Up in the Will of the Father”
item.description: Whenever Church members speak of consecration, it should be done reverently while acknowledging that each of us “come[s] short of the glory of God,” some of us far short (). Even the conscientious have not arrived, but they sense the shortfall and ar

item.title: “Becometh As a Child”
item.description: I add my warm welcome to the newly sustained Seventies, promising them friendship as we now company one another through the years which lie ahead.

item.title: “According to the Desire of [Our] Hearts”
item.description: Brothers and sisters, the scriptures offer us so many doctrinal diamonds. And when the light of the Spirit plays upon their several facets, they sparkle with celestial sense and illuminate the path we are to follow.

item.title: “From Whom All Blessings Flow”
item.description: The redeeming presence of our loving Father-God in the universe is the … supernal truth which, along with His plan of happiness, reigns preeminent and imperial over all other realities.

item.title: “Apply the Atoning Blood of Christ”
item.description: Christ paid such an enormous, enabling price for us! Will we not apply His Atonement in order to pay the much smaller price required for personal progress?

item.title: “Put Your Shoulder to the Wheel”
item.description: Work is always a spiritual necessity even if, for some, work is not an economic necessity.

item.title: Hope through the Atonement of Jesus Christ
item.description: Real hope is much more than wishful musing. It stiffens, not slackens, the spiritual spine.

item.title: “Repent of [Our] Selfishness” (D&C 56:8)
item.description: Meekness is the real cure, for it does not merely mask selfishness but dissolves it!

item.title: Lessons from Laman and Lemuel
item.description: Laman and Lemuel became rebels instead of leaders, resentful instead of righteous—all because of their failure to understand either the character or the purposes of God.

item.title: Content with the Things Allotted unto Us
item.description: Life’s necessary defining moments come within our allotments. … Our responses are what matter. Sufficient unto each life are the tests thereof!

item.title: The Tugs and Pulls of the World
item.description: Many individuals preoccupied by the cares of the world are not necessarily in transgression. But they certainly are in diversion and thus waste “the days of [their] probation” (2 Ne. 9:27).

item.title: “Plow in Hope”
item.description: By utilizing the Atonement, we access the gifts of the Holy Ghost, which “filleth with hope and perfect love” (Moro. 8:26).

item.title: The Seventh Commandment: A Shield
item.description: The keeping of the seventh commandment is such a vital shield! By lowering or losing that shield, the much-needed blessings of heaven are lost.

item.title: Consecrate Thy Performance
item.description: In pondering and pursuing consecration, understandably we tremble inwardly at what may be required. Yet the Lord has said consolingly, “My grace is sufficient for you” (D&C 17:8).

item.title: Encircled in the Arms of His Love
item.description: Perplexing things will still happen, but, like Nephi, we can still know that God loves us, a … fact which can and will sustain us through so much!

item.title: Care for the Life of the Soul
item.description: Truly converted disciples, though still imperfect, will pursue “the life of the soul” on any day, in any decade, amid any decadence and destruction.

item.title: How Choice a Seer!
item.description: If Joseph Smith had been the conduit for only one such divine revelation, it would be, standing alone, sufficient to ensure his prophetic greatness.

item.title: Remember How Merciful the Lord Hath Been
item.description: There are clusters of memories embedded in each of your lives. And these can help us to “remember how merciful the Lord hath been.”
